content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Electricity generator at position (-0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
– Steam engine at position (–0.5, 24.5)
– Boiler at position (–5.5, 24.0)
– Offshore pump at position (–7.5, 25.5)

### Copper cable factory at position (approx. 2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest at position (2.5, 17.5)
– Burner inserter at position (2.5, 16.5)
– Burner inserter at position (3.5, 17.5) (placed using direction RIGHT)
– Burner inserter at position (1.5, 17.5) (fuelled with coal)
– Burner inserter at position (0.5, 21.5)
– Assembling machine at position (1.5, 19.5)
– Output (wooden) chest at position (1.5, 21.5)

### Wooden chest belt depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– Wooden chest at position (3.5, 15.5) serving as the depot
– Transport belt segment at position (4.5, 15.5)
– Depot burner inserter at position (3.5, 14.5) (using direction UP)

### Extraction system at position (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction system burner inserter at position (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)
– Wooden chest at position (–3.5, 26.5)

### Smelting facility (multiple units) at positions around (–3.0, 19.0) and (–4.0, 21.0)
Consists of:
– Unit 1: Stone furnace at position (–3.0, 19.0) paired with a wooden chest at position (–4.5, 18.5)
– Unit 2: Stone furnace at position (–4.0, 21.0) paired with a wooden chest at position (–5.5, 21.5)

### Lab (research facility)
Consists of:
– Lab entity (with automation science pack input and electrical_id 7106)
  (position not specified)

ERROR TIPS
────────────
– When connecting transport belts, do not target a steam engine directly. Always interpose an inserter to serve as the belt’s input so that transport belts are never connected to a Prototype.SteamEngine entity.
– When placing a wooden chest, ensure the target tile is within the allowed placement range. Move closer to the target location to avoid “target position is too far away” errors.
– Before attempting placement, confirm that the required entity is available in the inventory to avoid “No … in inventory” errors.
– Verify variable names and references (for example, use the correctly defined target variable instead of an undefined identifier) to prevent NameErrors.
